alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; Greene; Lawrence; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 8:51PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Greene, Lawrence, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Center Creek at Azalea Drive, Butler Creek at Kings Highway, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road and Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Springfield, Republic, Neosho, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Cassville, Pineville, Willard, Marionville, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Ash Grove, Fair Grove, Pierce City, Goodman, Purdy, Billings, South West City, Seligman, Exeter, Miller, Wheaton, Walnut Grove, Verona, Washburn, Lanagan, Fairview, Dodge, Butterfield, Brookline, Stotts City, Newtonia, Pioneer, Halltown, Freistatt, Stella, Wentworth and Cayuga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Barry; Christian; Greene; Lawrence; McDonald; Newton
